One of our MUST EATs while in Barcelona, now that El Bulli is closed.  The menu changes with the season so it's hard to know what's "good' from prior reviews (though some things are there all year round, like the olives).  We let the chef/waiter choose our courses, but did make sure we put in some requests (like the olives and minibags of manchego cheese). I won't bore you with the individual items, but suffice it to say that it was an interesting experience.  Each item was definitely a vision - some things prepared and presented in a way I'd never seen before.  Taste-wise - honestly, I've had better, tastier meals.This place is definitely an experience.  Would I recommend it?  Sure - only because of Albert Adria and the overall fun, one-of-a-kind experience.  Would I go back if I returned to Barcelona?  Probably not.Note:  Try to get a reservation.  You can do this online about 2 months in advance (to the day, at midnight Barcelona time, which translated to early afternoon Los Angeles time).  Otherwise, you might get stuck in the line outside - and it's really hit or miss.  We saw poor foodies sitting out in the rain all throughout our meal, and while some did get in, the majority were still out there when we left...
